block.p: Stephanie Pearl-Ann Pennant, a daughter of Sybil and Mesado Pennant of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to Dr. Spencer Carl Saint-Cyr, a son of Monique and Carl Saint-Cyr of Miami. The Rev. Patson Agard, a minister of the Church of the Brethren, performed the ceremony at Milleridge Cottage, a catering hall in Jericho, N.Y.

Mrs. Saint-Cyr, 29, is an associate at Drinker Biddle & Reath, a law firm in Philadelphia. She graduated from the State University at Binghamton, N.Y., and received her law degree cum laude from Howard University. Her mother is a nurse in the dialysis unit of Brookdale Hospital Medical Center in Brooklyn. Her father is a senior estimator for the New York City Housing Authority.

Stephanie Pearl-Ann Pennant, a daughter of Sybil and Mesado Pennant of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to Dr. Spencer Carl Saint-Cyr, a son of Monique and Carl Saint-Cyr of Miami. The Rev. Patson Agard, a minister of the Church of the Brethren, performed the ceremony at Milleridge Cottage, a catering hall in Jericho, N.Y.

Mrs. Saint-Cyr, 29, is an associate at Drinker Biddle & Reath, a law firm in Philadelphia. She graduated from the State University at Binghamton, N.Y., and received her law degree cum laude from Howard University. Her mother is a nurse in the dialysis unit of Brookdale Hospital Medical Center in Brooklyn. Her father is a senior estimator for the New York City Housing Authority.

Dr. Saint-Cyr, also 29, is a resident in endodontics at Nova Southeastern University College of Dental Medicine in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine. His father owns Carvex, an industrial ceramics manufacturer in Miami.
